meanings.definition: A type of litter or palanquin used for carrying passengers.
meanings.sent1: The kago gently swayed as it carried the noble lady through the streets.
meanings.sent2: The tourists enjoyed the scenic ride in the kago around the ancient city.
meanings.sent3: The kago driver accidentally took a wrong turn and ended up in the marketplace!
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were carried in the kago of her mind, each one carefully placed.
meanings.sent5: The kago, adorned with colorful flowers, made a striking sight against the green landscape.

meanings.definition: A type of basket or container used for carrying goods.
meanings.sent1: The farmers loaded the kago with freshly harvested fruits to take to the market.
meanings.sent2: The picnic basket served as a convenient kago for all the delicious treats.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten jumped into the kago and tried to hide among the apples!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bubbled out of her like items spilling from an overturned kago.
meanings.sent5: The kago overflowed with treasures, each one a memory to be cherished.
